results.fragment:
My current toolkit is a simple subset of that menagerie. I use git for source code control, Tracker for issue management, Jenkins for Continuous Build, IntelliJ as my IDE, XUnit for testing, and FITNESSE for component testing.

My machine is a Macbook Pro, 2.8Ghz Intel Core i7, with a 17-inch matte screen, 8GB ram, 512GB SSD, with two extra screens.

results.fragment: There just weren’t that many senior programmers in the early seventies. Everywhere else I worked, I was senior. results.fragment:
Aside from having a gelled team working on your projects, the advantage of this scheme is that in an emergency the business can say, “Project B is in crisis; put 100% of your effort on that project for the next three weeks.”

Reallocating priorities that quickly is virtually impossible with the teams that came out of the blender, but gelled teams that are working on two or three projects concurrently can turn on a dime.
results.quote:
Aside from having a gelled team working on your projects, the advantage of this scheme is that in an emergency the business can say, “Project B is in crisis; put 100% of your effort on that project for the next three weeks.”

results.quote: In general, the business writes the happy-path tests, while QA writes the corner, boundary, and unhappy-path tests.

results.fragment: it should be the goal of the development group that QA find nothing wrong.
results.quote: it should be the goal of the development group that QA find nothing wrong.
results.epub_title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers

results.fragment: effectively eliminate communication errors between programmers and stakeholders is to write automated acceptance tests
results.quote: effectively eliminate communication errors between programmers and stakeholders is to write automated acceptance tests
results.epub_title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers

results.fragment: All too often both parties agree that they understand and leave with completely different ideas
results.quote: All too often both parties agree that they understand and leave with completely different ideas

results.fragment: Every time someone commits a module, the CI system should kick off a build, and then run all the tests in the system. The results of that run should be emailed to everyone on the team.
results.quote: Every time someone commits a module, the CI system should kick off a build, and then run all the tests in the system. The results of that run should be emailed to everyone on the team.
results.epub_title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers

results.fragment: Keep the GUI tests to a minimum
results.quote: Keep the GUI tests to a minimum
results.epub_title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers

results.fragment: The trick is to design the system so that you can treat the GUI as though it were an API rather than a set of buttons, sliders, grids, and menus
results.quote: The trick is to design the system so that you can treat the GUI as though it were an API rather than a set of buttons, sliders, grids, and menus
results.epub_title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers

results.fragment: Unit tests dig into the guts of the system making calls to methods in particular classes. Acceptance tests invoke the system much farther out, at the API or sometimes even UI leve
results.quote: Unit tests dig into the guts of the system making calls to methods in particular classes. Acceptance tests invoke the system much farther out, at the API or sometimes even UI leve
results.epub_title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers

results.fragment: Acceptance tests are written by the business for the business (even when you, the developer, end up writing them).
results.quote: Acceptance tests are written by the business for the business (even when you, the developer, end up writing them).
results.epub_title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers

results.fragment: Acceptance tests are not unit tests. Unit tests are written by programmers for programmers
results.quote: Acceptance tests are not unit tests. Unit tests are written by programmers for programmers
results.epub_title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers

results.fragment: Following the principle of “late precision,” acceptance tests should be written as late as possible, typically a few days before the feature is implemented
results.quote: Following the principle of “late precision,” acceptance tests should be written as late as possible, typically a few days before the feature is implemented
results.epub_title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers

results.fragment: ambiguity of “done.” When a developer says he’s done with a task, what does that mean? Is the developer done in the sense that he’s ready to deploy the feature with full confidence? Or does he mean that he’s ready for QA? Or perhaps he’s done writing it and has gotten it to run once but hasn’t really tested it yet.
results.quote: ambiguity of “done.” When a developer says he’s done with a task, what does that mean? Is the developer done in the sense that he’s ready to deploy the feature with full confidence? Or does he mean that he’s ready for QA? Or perhaps he’s done writing it and has gotten it to run once but hasn’t really tested it yet.
results.epub_title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers

results.fragment: Professional developers don’t flesh out a requirement until they are just about to develop it
results.quote: Professional developers don’t flesh out a requirement until they are just about to develop it
results.epub_title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers

results.fragment: Professional developers understand that estimates can, and should, be made based on low precision requirements, and recognize that those estimates are estimates. To reinforce this, professional developers always include error bars with their estimates so that the business understands the uncertainty.
results.quote: Professional developers understand that estimates can, and should, be made based on low precision requirements, and recognize that those estimates are estimates. To reinforce this, professional developers always include error bars with their estimates so that the business understands the uncertainty.
results.epub_title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers

results.fragment: In the end, the more precise you make your requirements, the less relevant they become as the system is implemented
results.quote: In the end, the more precise you make your requirements, the less relevant they become as the system is implemented
results.epub_title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers

results.fragment: Once they see the requirement actually running, they have a better idea of what they really want—and it’s usually not what they are seeing.
results.quote: Once they see the requirement actually running, they have a better idea of what they really want—and it’s usually not what they are seeing.
results.epub_title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers

results.quote: bit by bit I found myself implementing this application while he sat there and watched. Within the first twenty minutes it was clear that his emphasis had changed from learning how to do it himself to making sure that what I did was what he wanted.

results.fragment: My explanation simply made no sense to him at all

results.fragment: Professional programmers often suffer from a lack of diversity in the kinds of problems that they solve. Employers often enforce a single language, platform, and domain in which their programmers must work.
results.quote: Professional programmers often suffer from a lack of diversity in the kinds of problems that they solve. Employers often enforce a single language, platform, and domain in which their programmers must work.
results.epub_title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers

results.fragment: Practicing a suite of katas is a good way to learn hot keys and navigation idioms. It is also a good way to learn disciplines such as TDD and CI. But most importantly, it is a good way to drive common problem/solution pairs into your subconscious, so that you simply know how to solve them when facing them in real programming.
results.quote: Practicing a suite of katas is a good way to learn hot keys and navigation idioms. It is also a good way to learn disciplines such as TDD and CI. But most importantly, it is a good way to drive common problem/solution pairs into your subconscious, so that you simply know how to solve them when facing them in real programming.
results.epub_title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers

results.fragment: There have been several reports4 and studies5 that describe significant defect reduction. From IBM, to Microsoft, from Sabre to Symantec, company after company and team after team have experienced defect reductions of 2X, 5X, and even 10
results.quote: There have been several reports4 and studies5 that describe significant defect reduction. From IBM, to Microsoft, from Sabre to Symantec, company after company and team after team have experienced defect reductions of 2X, 5X, and even 10
results.epub_title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers

results.fragment:
• You are not allowed to write any production code until you have first written a failing unit test.
  • You are not allowed to write more of a unit test than is sufficient to fail—and not compiling is failing.
  • You are not allowed to write more production code that is sufficient to pass the currently failing unit test.
results.quote:
You are not allowed to write any production code until you have first written a failing unit test.
You are not allowed to write more of a unit test than is sufficient to fail—and not compiling is failing.
You are not allowed to write more production code that is sufficient to pass the currently failing unit test.
results.epub_title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers

results.fragment: and in general prove to ourselves that we have brains the size of a planet, all while not having to interact with the messy complexities of other people
results.quote: and in general prove to ourselves that we have brains the size of a planet, all while not having to interact with the messy complexities of other people
results.epub_title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers

results.fragment: No matter how skilled you are, you will certainly benefit from another programmer’s thoughts and ideas.
results.quote: No matter how skilled you are, you will certainly benefit from another programmer’s thoughts and ideas.

results.fragment: There is no way to rush. You can’t make yourself code faster. You can’t make yourself solve problems faster. If you try, you’ll just slow yourself down and make a mess that slows everyone else down, too.
results.quote: There is no way to rush. You can’t make yourself code faster. You can’t make yourself solve problems faster. If you try, you’ll just slow yourself down and make a mess that slows everyone else down, too.

results.fragment:
Managers are people with a job to do, and most managers know how to do that job pretty well. Part of that job is to pursue and defend their objectives as aggressively as they can.

By the same token, programmers are also people with a job to do, and most of them know how to get that job done pretty well. If they are professionals they will pursue and defend their objectives as aggressively as they can.
results.quote:
Managers are people with a job to do, and most managers know how to do that job pretty well. Part of that job is to pursue and defend their objectives as aggressively as they can.

By the same token, programmers are also people with a job to do, and most of them know how to get that job done pretty well. If they are professionals they will pursue and defend their objectives as aggressively as they can.
